text: Roller Coasters: Using Medians and IQR to Compare Speeds

The following table displays data from a census. It shows information about the population of roller coasters worldwide. About 95% of the coasters are steel-frame coasters; about 5% are wood-frame coasters.

The following dot plot and box plot show the top-speed data from a sample of 30 steel-frame roller coasters and 30 wood-frame roller coasters. The means, MADs, medians, and IQRs are marked for each roller coaster.

1. What do you consider to be a fast speed for a roller coaster?
  2. Are wood-frame roller coasters faster than steel-frame roller coasters? Explain your reasoning.

1. Answers will vary. 60 mi/h and higher seems fast for a roller coaster since that speed is like driving on a highway.
  2. Some students might say steel-frame coasters are faster because they include the highest speed even though there is more variability in the data distribution. Some students may say wood-frame roller coasters are faster because its mean is greater than steel-frame. In summary, the measures of center for steel- and wood-frame coasters are somewhat similar. Speeds of steel-frame coasters vary greatly. Measures of spread (specifically the IQR), show that at least 25% of the wood-frame coasters have speeds that are faster than those of steel-frame coasters. Some, but not all, steel-frame roller coasters are faster than wood-frame roller coasters. For example, wood-frame Coaster 30 has a top speed of 65 mi/h, but 3 steel-frame coasters have speeds of 66 mi/h or above. The median of the wood-frame coasters (50 mi/h) is slightly greater than the median of the steel-frame coasters (45.3 mi/h), but the middle 50% of speeds of steel-frame coasters are more variable than those of wood-frame coasters. The IQR for steel-frame coasters (24.8 mi/h) is more than twice the IQR for wood-frame coasters (10.8 mi/h). So there is more variability around the median for the steel-frame coasters. Based on the means, the speeds of wood-frame roller coasters, mean ≈ 48 mi/h, appear to be faster than the speeds of steel-frame coasters, mean ≈ 44.9 mi/h. There is more variability from the mean in the steel-frame roller coasters, with a MAD of 13.7 compared to the MAD of 7.5 with the wood-frame coasters.
